Articles.Content:
Hey guys. The other day my friend on an IRC channel told me about KSP, and I went and looked it up. The game looked -amazing-, so I downloaded the demo (.13). I instantly fell in love, and I pretty much played for like 7 hours straight. I finally got into a rather mediocre, crooked, and elliptical orbit after about 4 hours of gameplay. I eventually developed much more refined ship designs, and now I\'m up to using no solid fuel boosters, as they -do- make it a bit unwieldy. I bought the full version (currently .14) about 2 hours ago, and immediately began to enjoy all the added features. I currently have a pod in orbit, and I one day plan to orbit the sun with a satellite (from a mod?).

A little bit about myself, hm...

Well, I\'m from Portland, Oregon in the USA. It rains alot here. I\'m a ginger. I have to play KSP on my mother\'s shitty Mac, so a lot of it is just lag for me

Yeah, I aspire to basically just get a lot of pods, satellites and space stations orbiting everything

So, hi!

Welcome to the KSP Forums!

Happy Launching!

Arrr!

Capt\'n Skunky

KSP Community Manager

NOT AGAIN SKUNKY

Welcome to the forums, enjoy your stay!

-Mincespy

Bienvenidos a los foros de KSP!

Lanzamiento Feliz!

Hello Portland!

I\'m a big fan of rather mediocre, crooked, and elliptical orbits. I too have been learning the finer points of orbital mechanics. I read the forums daily and the amount of creativity/knowledge is really impressive. Ginger... Heehe I did not even know that word until the Southpark episode. I hope it stops raining for you!

Thor

Chief Engineer Insane Rockets Division
